column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat|identity
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Hi everyone , welcome back to my channel .
#Text=My name is Katie and today I 'm going to be talking about my two and a half week long vacation to Portland , Oregon .
#Text=So I am from Washington D.C. , and I have a bunch of family in Portland , Oregon , so it was n't my first time going there .
#Text=Um but it was definitely my first time , like as an adult .
#Text=So that was really exciting and fun .
#Text=I thought that I would make sort of like more of an informative video because I could just like post a vlog , but um the footage was like so random , and all over the place .
#Text=I got some really cool footage but um , not like cute like Instagram girl footage , because I did dress like a 12 year old boy the whole time .
#Text=So the first thing that I recommend you do in Portland is not actually in Portland at all .
#Text=So you might be like this is a terrible list .
#Text=Sorry .
#Text=The number one thing that we did on our trip was we actually stayed a night in Eugene , Oregon , and we got up at like the crack of dawn and drove to Crater Lake .
#Text=This was incredible .
#Text=Um one of the coolest things that I have ever seen .
#Text=The footage that I 'm gon na put in here honestly it looks a little bit fake .
#Text=This place was incredible .
#Text=We did n't do a whole lot of hiking here because there was not a whole lot of cloud coverage that day , and it was so hot .

#Text=So what we did was we drove around the entire perimeter of the lake and you get all these incredible views of the mountains and the lake , and seeing it from all the different angles was so worth it .

#Text=So maybe this is not something that you want to do if you 're just going to Portland for a couple of days but it 's definitely something to consider if you 're going out to Oregon for a little bit longer period of time .
#Text=Number two is shopping .
#Text=These are in no particular order by the way .
#Text=They 're just sort of like what I thought of as I was making this video .
#Text=So there 's a lot of cool shopping in Portland , Oregon .
#Text=A lot of cool thrifting and vintage stores , a lot of cool art galleries .
#Text=And then one of the biggest things that you should check out while you 're there is Powell 's which is a bookstore .
#Text=And I want to say it 's like the the biggest like Indie Indie bookstore in America .
#Text=I guess that 's what it 's called .
#Text=I 'm gon na – oh , it 's the world 's largest independent bookstore .
#Text=So this place was so cool we could have spent hours in here .
#Text=The best thing that I thought about this bookstore was that they mixed in new copies of books with used copies .
#Text=So if you 're looking for a book and you 're wondering like – oh I wonder if I could get this used , like it 's usually right next to it , which I thought was just like so awesome .
#Text=That was very exciting for me because I love a used book .
#Text=So I am not a huge like nature person .
#Text=Um I do n't enjoy bugs .
#Text=But um I will go on a good hike from now and again so just like you know where I 'm coming from .
#Text=My friend Andrea is a biology major so we did stop to look at many slugs that were on the ground and I did beeline it away from the slugs .
#Text=But if you like slugs , you 're in – you 're in luck .
#Text=So the first couple days we were in Portland , we went hiking in Forest Park which you can get to by public transit in the city .
#Text=It 's really quick and some of the trails even pop you back out into like the city , so it 's – it 's really super accessible .
#Text=So we did the Wildwood Trail and we also did a tour of Pittock Mansion .
#Text=Um if you do n't want to do a tour of Pittock Mansion , I 'd still recommend like taking the trail up there because it has a really cool like overlook of the city that you can go see .
#Text=Um I loved doing that .
#Text=So number four are the Japanese gardens and the rose gardens in Forest Park .
#Text=I actually do n't know if they 're like technically in Forest Park but they 're right in the same area .
#Text=So the rose garden is free and open to the public and it is just huge .
#Text=It 's a lot of roses as you can imagine .
#Text=Um lots of tourists but it was – it was still really fun .
#Text=You get to walk through all these gardens and different types of roses from different parts of the world and yeah it was just really cool .
#Text=Then the Japanese gardens you do have to pay for but I will say that it was definitely worth it .
#Text=If it 's a clear day you can actually see Mount Hood from the Japanese gardens which was really wild , and the garden was just so pretty and quiet and serene .
#Text=There were even some people like meditating in there which was kind of funny .

#Text=I did wear my bird shirt – It 's a pretty good bird shirt , I got a compliment on it – which I did n't say this earlier , but I bought this at the Audubon Society which I learned what that was .
#Text=I did n't know what that was but it 's um a society for um like bird watching and bird care and um they had a shirt that said bird nerd on it so I bought it because I thought it was funny .
#Text=But I was approached by – I want to say – at least three different people who asked me if I did bird watching like very seriously .
